objects.name: Analytic 0964
objects.description: User pastes an obfuscated command into Terminal.app/iTerm2 that decodes or downloads code and executes. Detects Terminal/iTerm2 spawning bash/zsh/python with suspicious pipeline/base64 patterns followed by file writes in ~/Library or /tmp and outbound network connections.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: exec: ParentImage in (Terminal, iTerm2) AND Image in (/bin/zsh,/bin/bash,/usr/bin/python*) AND CommandLine matches '(curl|wget).*(\||\|\s*sh|bash)|base64 -D|python -c'

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:osquery
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Interpreter exec with suspicious arguments as above

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: create: New files in /tmp or ~/Library/Application Support/* with executable or script extensions

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Egress to non-approved networks from host after terminal exec

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Terminal apps to treat as user-paste origins (Terminal, iTerm2, VSCode integrated terminal).
Developers/automation accounts expected to run such commands.
